message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CC, cs.CR 

This paper belongs to the arXiv CS sub-category of natural language processing (cs.CL) as it discusses two principal areas of NLP research in pragmatics. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel approach to speech act processing based on belief modelling techniques, which falls under the umbrella of machine learning (cs.AI) and computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also involves the use of planning and plan recognition, which are topics in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses limitations and potential security implications of previous approaches, which could fall under the category of computer security and cryptography (cs.CR) and computational complexity (cs.CC).
